law.catch_line: A tax lien shall be first paid and satisfied from the proceeds of a sale of any property of a person...

text.section: A tax lien shall be first paid and satisfied from the proceeds of a sale of any property of a person liable for the tax.

section.section: Notwithstanding subsection (a) of this section, a tax lien is not valid against any purchaser, holder of a security interest, mechanic's lienor, or judgment lien creditor until notice of the tax lien has been filed under § 13-807 of this subtitle.
Even if notice of a tax lien is filed, the lien is not valid against any claim described in § 6323(b), (c), or (d) of the Internal Revenue Code.

text.section: The rules and definitions in § 6323(e), (h), and (i) of the Internal Revenue Code shall apply in construing this section.
